availability.p: This work is the property of the Special Collections Library, University of Tennessee, Knoxville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Special Collections Librarian, Hoskins Library, University of Tennessee, 1401 Cumberland Avenue, Knoxville, TN 37996. (865) 974-4480.

bibl.title: [Receipt] 1795 Jul. 2, Knoxville, Territory of US south of Ohio River [to] David Henley / William Blount
bibl.author: Blount, William
bibl.note: This is a receipt given to David Henley of the War Department from Governor William Blount. It is for money given to William Rickard to be used for troop salaries. The receipt is dated July 2, 1795.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

keywords.term: Territory of the United States South of the River Ohio

address.addrLine: William Blount Governor in and over the Territory of the United States south of the river Ohio
To David Henley Esquire Agent for the Department of war

div.p: Pay to William Rickard Pay. Master pro tem to the Troops in the Territory aforesaid one hundred and thirty seven dollars eight cents out of the money on your hands appropriated for the defensive protection of the frontiers for the pay of a Department of Mounted Infantry of Mero DistrictColonel James Fords Regiment under the command of Captain George Briscoe from the fourteenth February, to the twentieth February 1794 agreeably to pay roll and your report thereon of this date, for which this shall be your warrant.
Given at Knoxville under my hand and seal this 2d July 1795

closer.add:
By the Governor
Chas Charles McClung
Pro Secretary
Recorded in the Secretary's Office July 2d 1795 Chas MClung Pro. Secretary
Received One hundred and thirty one dollars and eighty three cents in part of the within
